channel.title: Welcome to My Portfolio on My place
channel.description: Recent content in Welcome to My Portfolio on My place

item.title: Atomic perception
item.description:
The other day, I was listening to a podcaster named Theo Lion, who has a series of videos discussing his entrepreneurial journey. He backs his thoughts with knowledge gained from books.

I am not a passionate book lover, but I understood whyâ€”I’ve never had the chance to read an interesting book. I realized this statement when I started reading Atomic Habits, which Theo Lion recommended. In this first blog post, I will discuss some elements that have helped me become a better person. Understanding key concepts of habits and contextualizing them with personal experiences is essential for becoming more efficient. Let’s dive into it.

item.title: Domino, share your activity, get motivated
item.description:
Domino (the app final name is still under research and development) is an app created to enhance one’s experience of going outside. Let’s define a new term called instant tourism by looking into what the app offers.

The app is centered around a main function, placing activities on a map. Whenever you are going to the skatepark with friends, attending an old car gathering or even sipping a drink near the beach, you are free to share this activity by placing a pin on the map and describing few information… The goal is to motivate people to go outside and do activites they would have never done otherwise. It works best when in a foregn country or travelling to a place you haven’t meticulously prepared your tight planning. It gives you hints on where to eat, what to do, or find exceptional events on a 2h time-frame.
